t: Psalm 49
Why Should I Fear in Times of Trouble?
To the choirmaster. A Psalm of the Sons of Korah.
Hear*pn this, all peoples! Give*ld ear, all inhabitants of the world,
both*ln low and high, rich*ld and poor together!
My*ln mouth shall speak wisdom; the*ld meditation of my heart shall be understanding.
I*ln will incline my ear to a proverb; I*ld will solve my riddle to the music of the lyre.
Why*pn should I fear in times of trouble, when*ld the iniquity of those who cheat me surrounds me,
those*ln who trust in their wealth and*ld boast of the abundance of their riches?
Truly*ln no man can ransom another, or*ld give to God the price of his life,
for*ln the ransom of their life is costly and*ld can never suffice,
that*ln he should live on forever and*ld never see the pit.
For*pn he sees that even the wise die; the*ld fool and the stupid alike must perish and*ld leave their wealth to others.
Their*ln graves are their homes forever, their*ld dwelling places to all generations, though*ld they called lands by their own names.
Man*ln in his pomp will not remain; he*ld is like the beasts that perish.
This*pn is the path of those who have foolish confidence; yet*ld after them people approve of their boasts. Selah*ig
Like*ln sheep they are appointed for Sheol; death*ld shall be their shepherd, and*ln the upright shall rule over them in the morning. Their*ld form shall be consumed in Sheol, with no place to dwell.
But*ln God will ransom my soul from the power of Sheol, for*ld he will receive me. Selah*ig
Be*pn not afraid when a man becomes rich, when*ld the glory of his house increases.
For*ln when he dies he will carry nothing away; his*ld glory will not go down after him.
For*ln though, while he lives, he counts himself blessed— and though you get praise when you do well for yourself—
his*ln soul will go to the generation of his fathers, who*ld will never again see light.
Man*ln in his pomp yet without understanding is like the beasts that perish.
